Prerequisites: ACG 2021 AND ACG 2071 WITH A GRADE OF C OR BETTER
Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND THEORETICAL STRUCTURE OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING, REVIEW OF THE ACCOUNTING PROCESS, THE BALANCE SHEET AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURES, THE INCOME STATEMENT, COMPREHENSIVE INCOME AND THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS, REVENUE RECOGNITION AND PROFITABILITY ANALYSIS, THE TIME VALUE OF MONEY CONCEPTS, CASH AND RECEIVABLES, INVENTORY MEASUREMENT, PROPERTY, PLANT, AND EQUIPMENT AND INTANGIBLE ASSETS, ACQUISITION AND DISPOSITION.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE END OF THE COURSE, STUDENTS WHO COMPLETED ALL ASSIGNMENTS AND PARTICIPATED IN CLASS AND GROUP DISCUSSIONS SHOULD BE ABLE TO:
DISCUSS THE ROLE ACCOUNTING AS AN INFORMATION SYSTEM.
DISCUSS ECONOMIC RESOURCES.
DESCRIBE THE FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND LIABILITIES.
DISCUSS FINANCIAL REPORTING ISSUES
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
